title: How Are New Products and Services Developed in Businesses?
summary: When planning products, consider the target market, develop for existing customers or new markets, existing customers offer lower risk, new markets require marketing effort.
green_innovation: FALSE The article does not discuss any innovation related to green technologies or processes.
business_innovation: TRUE The text discusses developing new products for different markets, showcasing a new or improved business process.
green_product: FALSE The article does not detail the development of products designed to significantly reduce their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: FALSE The article does not delve into methods or techniques aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability in manufacturing or operations.
greenwashing: FALSE This text does not promote false or exaggerated environmental benefits; it discusses market planning considerations.

title: Consumer Products
summary: The article discusses George Washington Carver's role in developing new uses for Southern agricultural crops and teaching poor Southern farmers methods of soil improvement.

title: New Product Development and Introduction
summary: The article emphasizes testing new products in the market, creating prototypes, obtaining customer feedback, and conducting internal reviews to meet objectives.

title: The Pioneer Womanâ€™s 3 new Walmart-exclusive kitchen appliances are under $60 and available to shop now

title: New iMac
summary: The article discusses rumors surrounding the launch of a larger iMac, potential design features, and processor options, including the likelihood of a 30-inch or larger iMac with improved technology. Apple is considering color options based on the processor type used and potential changes in display technology, processors, webcam, and ports for this speculated new model.
